summary: The Puerto Rico Low-Income Housing Support Act aims to amend the definition of extremely low-income families under the United States Housing Act of 1937, specifically concerning Puerto Rico. It mandates a report from the Comptroller General on the efforts to connect low-income families in Puerto Rico with housing assistance and affordable dwelling units. The report will assess housing needs identification, use of disaster recovery funds, and provide recommendations for improving housing programs serving extremely low-income families in Puerto Rico.
